channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024061153
item.description:
Report X-2024061153

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO THE RATTLE AEROSOL SOUND HEARD COMING FROM THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWELVE X 24 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE SPRUH KONIG COVERING LACQUER. THE INNER BOX IS MARKED AND LABELED UN1950, AEROSOLS, FLAMMABLE WITH A 2.1 FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND LABEL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD SHIPPING BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.description:

  • City: CENTERVILLE
  • State: IN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNLOADER FOUND WET PACKAGE IN TRAILER, NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR WHO HAD A RESPONDER DON PPE, AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DAMAGE PROCESSING AREA. RESPONDER CLERK DONNED PPEIDENTIFIED CONTENTS AND FOLLOWING THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET(S) PROCESSED THE PACKAGE INTO A SPILL BUCKET TO BE PICKED UP AT A LATER DATE.

item.title: Report X-2024060513
item.description:
Report X-2024060513

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: JEFFERSONVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was discovered wet/leaking while being carried out of NOKY trailer 452059. Manager closest to the trailer was notified of the leaking hazmat. The package was quickly put in a hazmat tote and taken back to the designated hazmat cage. A small amount of liquid had spilled from the package. The materials used to clean the spill was also kept for proper disposal. Upon inspection of the package, it was discovered that one glass jar had broken during transport.

item.title: Report E-2024060081
item.description:
Report E-2024060081

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately seven (7) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent absorbents and containerized them into two (2) 5-gallon poly pails and the damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060062
item.description:
Report E-2024060062

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released form one (1) 5-gallon metal pail. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris and damaged pail into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024051876
item.description:
Report X-2024051876

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/20/2024 at approximately 1430, Dangerous Goods Administation recieved a call from Employee 472710 at the hub facility in Indianapolis, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing one can of paint. The package appeared to show signs of spillage during sort. Further investigation revealed damage to the inner container, resulting in the dislodging of the closure causing spillage. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended Shipper's Declaration for further transport.
